section.title: Continuously Payable Annuities with Non-Level Payments
section.p: We now shift to consider continuously payable annuities where the payments follow a non-constant function h(t). We will consider the case where the force of interest is constant, so that we have an effective periodic interest rate of \iota. The period will correspond to the units of t. We will finish by generalizing to a non-constant force of interest.
The integration involved makes use of integration-by-parts, so if you are not confident with this integration technique you should review it.
